p: Infections are among the most important complications in subjects affected by cancer and/or in recipients of hematopoietic stem cell transplantation (HSCT) and often endanger the life of the immunosuppressed patient [ 1]. Infections affecting the respiratory system are particularly frequent in this population, and those involving the lower respiratory tract (LRTI) are often related to the highest severity and mortality [ 1]. Among the various etiological agents, community-acquired respiratory viruses (CRVs) represent a relevant cause in terms of morbidity and mortality among patients with hematological malignancies [ 2].
